result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Wd Bodus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation along with Buy Money (to be paid to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random drug tests/urine screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to use or possess of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - First 90 days with Huber. Last 30 days STAYED for Agent's discretion as well as to the Huber or Straight Time. COMMENCE 3/07/2016 by 6pm.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Zachary Wd Bodus in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and strike the repeater allegation and count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:   
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random drug tests
*No Use or Possession of  controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done within 3 business days
 
Buy Money $170.00 to the City of Waukesha (to be paid as condition of probation)
 
COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 120 days, 1st 90 days with huber.  STAYED the last 30 days; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  
Sentence to commence 03/07/2016 by 6 pm. 

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
